16546590.review:
Fantastic game! Don't care about the graphics. It is outdated yes, but the gameplay makes you forget all about it as it is just amazing to be an officer for Rainbow Six.

This is the last best game in the series (Still waiting for the cod version of Rainbow Six, aka Siege), and is a must if you love S.W.A.T. 4 or any of the Rainbow Six games before Siege. If you love tactical shooters in general, this is a must buy.

Rainbow Six 3 has a really systematic and a fantastic planing phase, where you decide all the orders of what Teams Red, Green and Yellow shall do (if you have more than one team). You get to decide movement, actions, aggressiveness and order other teams/your team to wait until you give the command to move or the other team is ready. The enemy A.I. is not great, they react poorly to sounds and friendly corpses. If you run, they'll hear you through floors, if you shoot, they'll only hear you if your standing next to them. If they witness someone die, they don't care, why should they?

Shooting feels great and realistic. It is really hard to hit something if you're not aimed down your sight. If you spray, you'll miss your target and probably die. Bullets are deadly, meaning you'll die in just a few bullets even with the heavy gear. You're not a bullet sponge, be careful around corners.

Leaning, leaning around corners is REALLY important here, and they've done a fantastic job with that. There is the standard q and e to lean, but also ctrl. With controll, you can lean how ever you want, it makes taking cover a much easier job than in other shooters.

RS3 has the standard gamemodes, Terrorist Hunt (killing terrorists), Hostage Rescue, Bomb defusal and so on. However, in RS3, hostages can and will be shot by Ts, if not careful. If they're alerted, they'll shot them without hesitation. Plan your moves, don't run and gun, and be f#cking careful.

I love the Rainbow Six series, and fully recommend getting all of them. They are fantastic games, and hopefully Siege will be as well.

Ein wirklich großartiger "Klassiker" der Rainbow Six Reihe. Wer dieses Spiel noch nie gespielt hat, sollte das dringend nachholen. Die Grafik ist zwar nicht mehr die aktuellste, aber es macht wirklich Spaß. Noch mehr Spaß macht es, wenn man mit Freunden das ganze zockt. Es gibt jede Menge Waffen und Zubehör für die Waffen wie etwa Schalldämpfer. Man kann sogar den Munitionstypen bestimmen.

Ihr müsst in diesem Spiel taktisch vorgehen. Einfach reinrennen und alles ummähen wird meistens mit dem sofortigen Tode bestraft. Leise und Vorsichtig sollte man sich durch die Map bewegen. Die KI ist ziemlich ausgeklügelt und reagiert auf Schüsse, Schritte und Türen die geöffnet werden. Ihr habt keinen Lebensbalken mit 100 Punkten. Wenn euch 3-4 Kugeln treffen seid ihr Tot. Das gibt dem ganzen nochmal ein wenig mehr Spannung. Ihr habt als Lebensanzeige nur eine kleine Kugel. Sie kann Voll, Halb Voll und Leer sein.

Solltet Ihr die 5 Euronen überhaben, scheut euch nicht dieses großartige Spiel nachzuholen. Am besten mit Freunden. Glaubt mir, es macht es Spaß - zumindest wenn man auf Taktik-Shooter steht. ;)

15515986.review:
Truthful in its nature of strategy and action, R63 is quite undeniably the last true tactical game to have come in the series.
Pitting you in a what-would-be a spec op's worst nightmare scenarios too crazy for real-life, you're given simple objectives that usually encompasses rescuing hostages, preventing certain destruction, and all the while killing everyone else in sight (enemies do rarely surrender though). The levels are great and complex, but some may prove to be too much of a challenge, with some of the most unforgivingly tough gun combat you'll face. As hard as it can get, this instead left me craving for more for some reason.
Enjoyment is however, marred by a few technicalities to the likes of the occasional dumb but crazy aimbotting enemy AI and slightly underwhelming gunplay. What's more annoying is the incompetency of your own teammates, who may fare well in the easier levels but get completely obliterated in certain, more assault-oriented levels. Ultimately it doesn't matter how much strategic map planning comes into play, it all boils down to the player's own level of FPS skills for the best success, which puts into question the real importance of the [i]tactical[/i] aspect.

Regardless, this game goes far behind SWAT 4 as one of the best tactical shooter I've ever played. And given the state of the Tactical Shooter genre that has since died off in gaming trend, this position will always remain as such, sadly.

14768081.review:
A lot of action games and shooters seem to glorify violence and bathe the player in it in mindless, yet entertaining, way, but Rainbow Six 3 (like its predecessors) abandon this concept for a more realistic perspective on violence.

The gameplay is brutal. You're not a bullet-soaking hero that can kill wave after wave of enemies. Instead, you're a fragile human with only his squad and tactics to guide you through. A single bullet can end your character's life, and it is because of this that violence in the game is more often feared and respected. Everything from the planning of the mission to the way you enter of your room is in your control, but a slight slip-up can leave you with multiple casualities—all of which are permanent for the rest of the game.

If you're looking for a game that focuses more on tactics and realism, rather just pointing and clicking on enemies, then look no further.

13747884.review:
tl;dr This game is a tactical shooter, so it may not be for everyone. It can still be fun to play with people, granted they know what they are doing. The game may have some technical flaws (it being old). If you want to play good old Rainbow Six without wrestling with the Original's engine, pick this one up.

Rainbow Six 3 is a squad based, tactical shooter. This game allows you to take control of the elite counterterrorism unit RAINBOW (yes, that's the name of the unit).

This game is not something you rush into. You need tactics. The game has an entire planning phase where you can modify how each group of operatives moves. You can tell them to wait on your mark, then when you give the go-code, open the door and flash through it.

Multiplayer still works, however you have to have a uPlay account. You could try lan or hamachi, but I didn't test that. 

The game has a mutlitude of weapons and armor for you to choose. You can use silenced smgs with flashbangs and go full on stealth, or use 50.cal snipers and M4's with frag grenades to go all out.

This game is also not as easy as your usual FPS. You get a maximum of 1-3 hits before your dead. Everyone follows this rule. Once someone's dead, they can no longer be chosen, so make sure your teammates don't die.

The game also has some mechanics that I've never seen any other FPS have before, or after. These are the fluid lean and door opening. Using the mouse, you can adjust your character to lean at many other angles other than one. Fluid door opening allows you to open doors halfway, a tiny bit, or just enough to let a grenade through.

That said, the game has flaws. The planning stage is locked at ~800x600 (the game isn't but the menus are). The game can sometimes be a bit hard to get into, and you may have to do levels over and over to make sure your preferred teammates didn't die. This game is way different than alot of FPSes out today (Call of Duty, Team Fortress, and Battlefield aren't very comparable. Counter-Strike is a bit comparable, but still has alot of differences).

Rainbow Six 3 is one of my favorite games. I have been playing it since its release and have to say, that this game does not get older at all! 
One of the main issues is the number of maps - it is more than 15 and if you buy the 'Athena Sword' expansion pack, then you have dozens of them. Also the choice of guns is impressive - you can pick from higher number, than in e.g. any CoD series game.
But what makes the game unique is planning and executing the plans. You need to pick at least one soldier (up to 8 with 4-men limit per squad) and here is your choice. You may plan exactly your actions, so that you do not need to even touch the keyboard, because the soldiers will do everything for you. You may play it as a shooter (though a much harder one, than the new ones) or play a 'hybrid' version - plan some key actions -e.g. synchronize the assault of one room (with a hostage being kept there for example) and attack it from two sides. It doesn't matter, which playing style you enjoy more, because it will be great anyway.
If you're a fan of a true gameplay and enjoy playing tactical shooters - this game is perect for you!

13325210.review:
This game was the peak of Ubisoft's Rainbow Six franchise. Here is why;

-Realistic AI. The enemy AI will execute hostages if they see the player, run if they are outnumbered, and even surrender to trick the player into letting your guard down, so that their friend can shoot the player in the back! 
-Lots of weapons, gear, and customisability. One can customise not only their own soldier's weapons, gear, and armour, but their teammates as well. 
-Planning. The game allows the player to set waypoints for their team and AI teams, and the AI teams will automattically follow. One can even set "Go codes" to make the AI wait for the code to begin an action, such as breaching. 
-The multiplayer still works. One can set up their own dedicated server in a few simple steps. See my discussion post for help. 
-Lots of fun game modes and maps. This game has many fun game modes, such as Lone Wolf (terrorist hunt alone); Terrorist Hunt (kill all the terrorists); and Hostage Rescue (self-explanatory). It also features classic maps such as Peak, Presidio and Prison. 
-Fairly good graphics. While these graphics aren't amazing, they still hold up well today. 
-Non-linear maps. Play your way. 

So, if you have played Rainbow Six Vegas 1 or 2, come see what the classic games were like! If you've never played Rainbow Six before, now is a great time to start!

13123702.review:
While I do not have an abundance of hours clocked on this game, I did have the disc when it came out in 2003. Since then, I have played that thing to death: memorizing enemy locations, the stats of certain characters, and the best weapons combinations. Why? Because not only does this game have excellent gameplay, but no matter how many times you beat it, you can always find better ways to play, or cooler ways to succeed.

The positive aspects of the game are inherent to the gameplay - being a tactical shooter, Rainbow Six 3 (Raven Shield) with its expansions let you use maps to guide ally movements and actions. An example: I know that there is a hostage at the room on the right above the stairs. I can map Green Team, the group I have equipped with heavy assault rifles, to breach the double doors in the center while Red Team, with their silenced weapons, push through the exit in the back, cutting them off quickly. This all happens while I send Gold team to snipe from the runway, ensuring no tangos get the jump on us. We go on the call "Bravo."
It's the most fun I have had playing a Tom Clancy Game.

The negatives come only with the age of the game. It was made in 2003, so the graphics, compared to today, are sub-par. That also means the the AI is a little slow and flawed. Sometimes terrorists can pinpoint your position and pull off a headshot without ever knowing you were there, and sometimes your allies will walk into a full warehouse of badies walking backwards, continuing the slaughter. This can be incredibly aggravating, but these occurences are few and far between.

You have a lot of freedom with gun customization, especially for a game of this particular era, and a lot of freedom with how you plan and execute your missions. This is a must play for any Tom Clancy fan. 8/10

12868418.review:
Probably one of the best (if not the best) tactical shooter of all time.
You need both intelligence and pure skills to complete all missions it has to offer. The "run and gun"  tactic will just get you killed when teamplay, stealth approach and smart progression are the keys to succeed.
Remember that the ennemy shares the same weakness and strenght than you: one shoot, one kill, good accuracy, various gear (rifles, grenades).
The game provide an excellent content, even more with the Athena Sword extension. A huge range of maps and weapons with several gamemode (terrorist hunt, hostage, lone wolf...) in single player, cooperative and competitive.
Technically, the game is old, but still watchable. The sounds are great and the feeling is perfect. You actually feel that the weapons are design to kick asses.
In fact, it's still a "must have" and I enjoy it really, really much.

One last thing... Whoever he is, just shoot down the guy who did the screenshots on the stre page. It really does not show the graphical quality of the game. You'd better watch players screenshots.

Probablement un des meilleurs (si ce n'est le meilleur) shooter tactiqued e tous les temps.
Vous aurez besoin de faire preuve d'autant d'intelligence que de pure talent pour arriver au bouts des nombreuses missions proposées.Les tactiques "run and gun" ne suffirons qu'à vous faire tuer alors que le travail d'équipe, l'approche furtive et la progression refléchieseront les clés du succès.
Souvenez vous que les ennemys possèdent les même forces et faiblesses que vous: Une balle, un mort, bonne précision, équipement varié (fusils, pistolets, grenades...).
Le jeu propose un contenu excellent, surtout avec l'extension Athena sword. Un grand nombre de map et d'armes avec à chaque fois plusieurs modes de jeu, le tout en solo, en coopératif ou en competitif.
Techniquement, le jeu est vieux, mais reste largement regardable. Les effets sonores sont supers et le feeling efficace. On sens et entend que les armes sont faites pour déboiter du terroriste à la pelle.

En fait, ça reste un indispensable et je prend toujours enormément de plaisir à y jouer.

Une dernière chose... je sais pas qui s'en est chargé, mais que quelqu'un abatte le gars responsable des screenshots de la page magasin de steam. Ils ne rendent pas du tout justice à l'aspect graphique du jeu. Je pense qu'il ont été faits à une époque ou les PC ne parvenaient pas à le faire tourner à fond. 11691806.review:
I love this game. This game was one of my very first gaming experiences. Before Neopets. Before Pokemon. Before my PS1 and Xbox. Before Warcraft 3 and Diablo and all the other good stuff. I used to play this all the time with my dad, and as such constitutes some of my fondest childhood memories.

Anyway, let's dive right in.

This game has technical issues. The menus are locked to 800x600 (?) resolution, though the game itself supports much higher resolutions. It did 1080p just fine for me. However, due to the different resolutions, your resolution will fluctuate whenever you enter/leave the menus. Kind of annoying, but no big deal. You better get used to the low resolution though, because you'll be spending a lot of time in the planning menu. Which brings me to my next point...

This is not your typical action FPS. It's relatively slow paced and you spend a lot of time planning things out. There are 3 teams you can customize. You can outfit each team member with different armor, weapons, weapon attachments, various types of grenades, and various utility tools. During planning you can dictate where your teams go, how they go there, what they do when the reach there, etc.

For example, you might want green and gold team to wait for your signal ("Alpha, go!") before they clear a particular room. 

- Want one team to throw a smoke and the other to throw a flashbang before doing storming the room? Done. 
- Locked door? No problem, tell them to breach it first.
- Hostages? Throw some tear gas in. Don't worry, you can outfit your guys with gas masks.

There is a ton of ways to complete missions. You can take control of a team as well, and co-ordinate with the other teams in clearing a level. 

AI sometimes spotty. On occasions the AI will get stuck bumping into one another, or they'll be looking in stupid directions while taking fire. Most of the time though the AI is quite capable. You'll see your teams moving in formation, covering for one another. They'll strafe into rooms. I've actually been saved by my AI companion more times than I can count, so they're certainly not a burden.

There is auto-aim, but you can turn it off. You can also configure how sensitive you want the auto-aim to be.

There is a lot of trial and error. Your plans will not work on the first try. You'll be going through the level halfway when one of your teams starts getting killed off. Then you'll go back to the planning stage and try to rectify the flaws in your master plan. Maybe green team should throw a smoke before storming this particular room. Maybe you should reposition gold team so that they can better cover fire for green team. This is as much a strategy game as it is an action one.

Another this is that death is permanent. You have a roster of soldiers, and if they die during a mission, they will not be available for subsequent missions. This gives you an incentive to complete missions with minimum casualties. Soldiers can be wounded too, making them move slower and have slower reflexes. Wounded soldiers recover after a couple missions.

This game is fantastic, but it's not for everyone. It can't really be compared to anything else on the market. Unfortunately the Rainbow Six series is no longer the tactical shooter it once was.

11624248.review:
This game was and is the pinnacle of tactical shooters, it was a serious improvement on the already amazing original Rainbow Six games and it was the last installment of the Rainbow Six series that kept the spirit of the original. Though I did enjoy them, The Rainbow Six Vegas games were a little watered down to cater to the casual gamer compared to Raven Shield and Athena Sword. In fact, I believe this was the last decent and truely "realistic" tactical FPS. There are tons of maps in this game that allow for play styles varying from precise, patient and meticulously planned long range engagements to savage, fast paced and adrenaline fueled Close Quarters Battle. There is a massive selection of weapons, attachments, class specific items and even ammunition types allowing the player to tailor their kit to their play style. The armory is bigger than any game that I can think of. Because of this, the replayability of this game is endless. 

While it continues to be surprisingly entertaining for a game released in 2003, it is beginning to show it's age and lacks some of the innovative features seen in modern games. The player cannot look down the iron sights of the weapons. Unless optics are mounted on the weapon, the right mouse button only causes a zoom effect. Also the graphics are a bit obsolete. The installation of the Ravenshield 2.0 mod fixes this, however, by improving textures and adding many of the features (including iron sights) that we as gamers have become accustomed to in the last decade. 

To summarize, if you haven't played this game and you crave a challenging, thinking man's tactical shooter over the mindless run and gun FPS' you get these days you need this in your Steam library. If I can play this game consistently for over a decade without it getting old, I'm pretty sure you can get at least 100 hours out of it. Do yourself a favor and pull the trigger on this one, you won't regret it.

11523673.review:
밀리터리 FPS 장르의 대부인 레인보우 식스 시리즈.
단순한 액션 게임이 아닌 전술적인 시스템을 가미함으로써 1998년도 첫 출시 당시까지만 해도 매우 혁신적인 게임이였습니다.
둠이나 울펜슈타인처럼 람보식 플레이를 지향하지 않고 '밀리터리'라는 색깔에 맞게 사실적인 플레이를 지향하였습니다.
지금 스팀에는 레이븐 쉴드의 전작이자 레인보우 식스의 붐을 이끈 오리지날과 로그스피어가 판매가 되고 있지 않아 많이 아쉽지만 전작의 색깔을 그대로 가져온 레이븐 쉴드로도 전작의 명성을 간접적으로 체험할 수 있을겁니다.

이 게임의 특징은 사실적인 게임성과 전술성입니다.
재수 없으면 총알 한방에 그 자리에서 즉사할 수 있고 운이 좋아도 3~4발 맞으면 사망하게 됩니다.
또, 총을 맞아서 살아남았다고 하더라도 어디 부위에 맞았느냐에 따라 캐릭터의 에임이 심하게 벌어진다거나 움직임이 매우 둔해지기도 하는 등 굉장히 리얼하게 묘사했습니다.
(레이븐 쉴드는 전작과 다르게 어느 부위에 맞든 다리를 절룩거리더군요...)
하지만 이 게임의 가장 큰 백미는 전술성입니다.
다른 타 게임들과 달리 레인보우 식스는 곧 바로 현장에 투입되지 않습니다.
그 전에 상황에 대한 브리핑을 듣고 그 다음엔 무기고에서 각 대원마다 아이템을 셋팅, 최대 8명의 인원으로 작전과 팀을 구성 하고 출동해야 합니다.
혼자서 플레이를 하는게 아닌 분대장으로써 자신을 제외한 7명에게 작전실에서 계획했던 것처럼 움직이도록 현장에서 지시를 내려야 합니다.
작전만 완벽하게 계획해 놓으면 게임 시작시 명령키만 눌러도 본인은 손 하나 까딱안하고 분대원들이 알아서 미션을 완료 시켜 버리는 경이로운 상황도 연출 할 수 있습니다.
(작전을 완벽하게 계획했더라도 인공지능의 한계로 변수가 매우 많습니다.)

그리고 플레이 도중 아군이 사망하게 되면 미션을 완료해도 다음 미션엔 이용할 수 없게 됩니다.
그렇다고 중간에 체크포인트나 퀵세이브가 안되기 때문에 능력 좋은 부대원이 다수 사망하면 다시 작전을 구상하는 편이 좋습니다.
그렇지 않으면 사망한 레인보우 식스의 멤버들을 땜빵하기 위해 달려온 이름 그대로 신뢰성이 느껴지지 않는 '유엔군' 소속 부대원들과 함께 위험한 현장에 나가야 하는 불상사를 겪게 됩니다.

어쨌든 인질이 한명이라도 사살당하면 미션을 처음부터 다시 시작해야하는 등 성질 급하고 인내가 없는 플레이어에겐 쥐약같은 게임이긴 합니다만 그 속에서 이 게임의 진정한 색깔이라고 할 수 있는 사실성과 긴장감에 맛을 들이게 된다면 이 게임의 매니아가 되어버린 자신을 발견하게 될 겁니다.

테러로부터 세계를 여러 번 구한 인류 최고의 테스크 포스 팀인 레인보우 식스 세번째 이야기를 담은 이 작품을 모쪼록 즐겁게 플레이 하시길 바랍니다.

11229692.review:
If you ever felt like FPS games today were just shooting galleries, then you should probably pick up this game.

I was there, I fought the war against Supersoldier-Nazi-Terrorists from the future. I played Rainbow Six on the console and I beat it once... only once. The game has you playing against Supersoldier-Nazi-terrorists from the future, seriously you should watch the intro... that's the only way I can explain the story, for America. You thought CoD: World at War was deep? This game is deeper. This game is about fighting for America.... in Switzerland.

As a fun, challenging game, Rainbow Six has you taking control of up to three teams and with you planning out their movements along with placing checkpoints yourself. As you start the mission and having your teams following their pre-constructed paths, they will all inevitably die to the incredible aim of the Super-soldier-Nazi-Terrorists (I always manually take control of teams and members to make sure no one dies). Still, it was much easier than the console version which basically had you and three other guys (or four, I forgot) with no backup and running into a whole lotta crossfires and traps. Men get blown to pieces by Terrorists with their grenades and you will get cutdown mercilessly by molten metal fired from the barrels of hidden guns.

This game is easier, with the ability to pre-plan your movements and the ability to take control of multiple teams and team members. This game isn't about twitch shooting or aim, it's about precaution. Precaution as in, "Don't run in clear view of a sniper you dumbfuck." The game doesn't hold your hand and requires a lot of luck at times, but in all honesty it is how you plan and how you plan to execute it along with a plan B if everything goes wrong. If you find firefights too frustrating, the game even allows aim assist (the equivalent of aimbotting). You have to anticipate the shittiest situations and how to deal with them. I like the weapons, most of them have different stats and have situational advantages during some missions. However, shotguns are completely inaccurate unless you've got a scope on it (which I find strange).

Team members also have stats and it somewhat rewards you for keeping them alive. The more men survive through missions the better stats they get, so they can aim better, run better, etc. Always keep stealth team members with other stealth team members otherwise the other dudes in the group will give them away. Having a balanced number of team members and organizing their equipment is actually.... fun.

I get to choose what weapon to use, what grenades I want and who I want with me. Yeah, the game can get frustrating at times, but mostly it is your fault if you lose. You have to observe enemy movement, study their patrol paths and watch them intently then plan actions accordingly. You can't run in every room throwing a smoke grenade because of your limited supplies. The heartbeat sensors actually make the game easier because you can see where terrorists are going through the walls and doors (console game had thermal vision). You're never supposed to fight the enemy head-on not unless you've put yourself in a advantageous situation (i.e. smoked room enemy can't see you, flash bang renders terrorists unable to fight back etc.).

Multiplayer is also a blast, if you ever get to play just use your Uplay account username and password. I had to play with three or so other guys against hordes of terrorists in the other room with us throwing tear gas this way and that. There are plenty of wonderful pvp and pve levels that has you killing terrorists on top of buildings, in cities, on boats and wherever the strange and unique level designs take you. Did I tell you I got to fight Nazi Terrorists... IN SPACE?!

Go buy it but keep in mind it's tough difficulty and sometimes frustrating nature.

I personally have been playing the R6 Vegas series for a very long time and have enjoyed it to this day
Although i have played the old Rainbow Six Games before but not much. Only have played Rogue Spear

What do i think of this game ? Well, coming from a person who have been playing Spunkgargleweewee, i really enjoy
Rainbow Six 3 Raven Shield
I would say it's an almost perfect sequel to the 2 older games, Rogue Spear and the original Rainbow Six.
Having better graphics and surprisingly, first person view models. Texture is better, character models are well detailed
Gameplay-wise, it's still the same old Rainbow Six game; Slow-paced, u die very easily and u only get one chance.

The game is pretty fun and frustrating at the same time coz u'll never know what is gonna come up next. Clearing rooms, wide areas, u wont know whether u'll die or not and that's the point of being tactical. Cover the corners, make sure that the room is clear, using different grenades to ur advantage.

In conclusion, if u're a fan of Rainbow Six, this is the last Rainbow Six game right before the Vegas series to stand true to the old Rainbow Six vibe. I recommend u to pick it up and just play it. Although the online experience is pretty dead but there are a few servers that has players in them.
If u're NOT a fan of Rainbow Six, it is ur choice. Whether u like slow-paced shooters or not, i highly recommend it.

I'd give this game an 8/10. Thank u for reading :)

10866027.review:
This is definitely one of my most favorite games of all times!
I used to play it since it's been released, and occasionally come back to play it once in a while.
From all tactical shooters I played, this one is definitely the best.
(in my opinion at least)

It has a lot of maps, game modes, tons of weapons (like... I haven't seen this much weapons in most other shooters).
There are usually lots of ways to approach a mission, so it never gets boring to me.


More importantly, this game is REALLY great at coop-gameplay. (so I'm focusing on that)
In fact it's one of it's big strenghts were it excells vs. other shooters in my opinion.

The AI is fully functional (no bugs AFAIK) and coop-missions with other players against the AI are really a lot of fun.
Usually the AI is occupying some building, and you and your squad (up to 8 players) need to clear the building or rescue hostages or whatever else there is to do, depending on the game mode selected.

You have to work as a team, coordinate actions etc. in order to win against up to 35 (or even 40?) terrorists.
No annoying "spawns" of enemies behind your back, like it's in the newer Rainbow Six Vegas games.
Every enemy is placed on the map right at the start of the game, so no one "spawns".

The only way they can end up behind you is either if they are patroling or if they spot you and "escape", they usually try to flank you or they run away and cause trouble for some of your teammembers.
But there is no way they can "spawn" behind you, as they are placed on the map right at the start of the round.
(enemies that spawned behind my back were a huge annoyance in RS Vegas 2 to me...)

Anyway, this game really gives me the impression that I'm working in an elite squad consisting of 8 members, that has to take out a bunch of terrorists.
There is no other game that's better at delivering this "feeling".
At least I don't know of it, if there is any equal or better at all.

I recommend this game to anyone who likes to play tactical shooters with coop-gameplay.

9409233.review:
On entend souvent murmurer autour d'une table gammée que le FPS est un genre monotone, nobrain et répétitif. Des phrases au nazisme incisif qui ont dû polluer vos oreilles plus d'une fois. "Pan-pan" ; "tous les mêmes" ; "ils se ressemblent tous". Quel racisme. Les FPS ne sont même pas asiatiques.

Rainbow Six enrichit la mappemonde immensément diverse du microcosme du jeu de tir à la première personne d'une approche tactique que les amateurs de la série SWAT ne renieront pas. L'équipe Rainbow, la dream team de dernier recours constituée de l'élite de plusieurs pays, est envoyée aux quatre coins du monde pour sauver des otages et empêcher des bombes d'exploser. A vous de l'intégrer et la commander au cours de ses multiples opérations. Il n'est ici nullement question de rentrer dans le tas seul contre tous armé d'une mitraillette façon Serious Rambo-Nukem mais au contraire d'appréhender avec le plus grand respect chaque couloir ou balcon susceptible de cacher un terroriste, d'ouvrir l'oeil comme un carnivore à l'affut de proies tout aussi dangereuses que lui. Il n'est pas non plus question d'appuyer bêtement sur start sitôt l'écran de mission balayé du regard et de foncer dans le tas  ; il faudra prendre le temps de planifier ses équipes, son équipement et son plan d'action afin de minimiser les risques ; puis entrer dans le vif du sujet. Donner des ordres, nettoyer une pièce depuis deux points d'entrée simultanément, placer les snipers à des endroits stratégiques pour couvrir les troufions vulnérables, en bref penser chaque mouvement comme dans une partie d'échecs. Ce troisième épisode propose des missions variées de très grande qualité (Alcatraz !) qui promettent toutes un vrai challenge - on doit s'approprier chaque carte avant de vraiment pouvoir s'y balader et il ne faudra pas rechigner à passer l'arme à gauche ; on n'est pas loin d'un (très bon) die & retry. Le jeu est complet avec une campagne solo et un multijoueur de qualité, que ce soit en versus ou en coopération. Je regrette juste que cette Gold Edition ne comporte pas la relecture Black Arrow qui, j'ai honte de l'avouer, me plaisait bien.

S'il fallait ne jouer qu'à un seul et unique Rainbow Six façonné dans le respect de l'ancienne formule pré-Lockdown/Vegas, ce serait ce troisième épisode. Tant pis si je dois me mettre tous les fan(atique)s de Rogue Spear à dos, il est grand temps que la vérité éclate au soleil : Rainbow Six 3 détruit Rogue Spear sur à peu près tous les plans, CQFD. R63>R6RS plus puissant que e=mc1+1=2.

9378725.review:
What can one say about R6:Raven shield?. Pure excellence - it's the last great Rainbow Six from the long running series, at least in terms of tactical gameplay. The rainbow six vegas games put an emphasis on action and nonstop brawl over the slow, tactically and "smart" gameplay that dominates the 3 first games. It takes what made the first 2 excellent and further pushes it. Some still say Rainbow Six: Rogue spear is the pinnacle of the series but i still feel the 3rd installment is the best one. It gives you the tools and gameplay to push Rainbow Six as far as you want it to go. It's emphasis is more on the neutralization of targets and objectives and it's somewhat more "intense" then say for example Swat 3/4 which has a focus on doing things with the bare minimum of violence. Rainbow Six: raven shield gives you all the tools to do what you feel works best, being less lethal takedowns with flashbangs, or the brute force tactic of breaching charges and frag grenades - all the tools are there to be played around with for one of the most interesting tactical shooters in the last 15 years.

Must buy for any tactical shooter junkie.

9283374.review:
You hear the slow, incessant chirp. The pause between each beep seems to get shorter and shorter, but it could be your imagination. There's a corner between you and the bomb. You slooowly ease around the wall, practically kissing your MP5 as you strain to make out the shape of an arm, a head, a sign that someone is around that corner, lying in wait for an operative like yourself.

There's no one. You run up to the bomb, and are immediately shot in the back of the head. You have no idea where it came from, no corners of your vision conveniently glowing red to give an indication of where your assassin is. You can't back out and wait for a few seconds to heal up. You got shot in the back of the head. It's over. Your man is dead. And it was your fault.

You didn't look up.

They don't make 'em like this anymore.

I've been playing this game since 2005. It has never gotten old. If I had to choose one game from my entire library to keep, it would be this. And if you're the sort of person who thinks this is "too hard" or "too boring," and goes back to knife people in Call of Warfare 23 or Modern Duty 97 or something, then I'm sorry, you /are/ an inferior human being.

Tactical shooters are dead. Long live Rainbow Six 3.

9251252.review:
I was already familiar with the original Xbox version, though my memory of it isn't detailed, and the semi-modern Vegas games. Both Vegas games have their fair share of problems, including bad third-person cover systems, enemies that spawn behind you, nonsensical instant deaths, sound glitches, and (in the case of Vegas 2) a sprint function that makes the multiplayer feel more like a slower CoD than a tactical shooter. Everyone on the internet told me that RS3 is better in every way, the definitive tactical shooter.

They were wrong.

Rainbow Six 3 has enemies that can't hear gunfire from 10 feet away or see their friends die right in front of them, but they are quite capable of seeing through brick walls and hearing footsteps from across the room. On more than one occasion, I died at random, one time by an explosion that didn't have an accompanying grenade or terrorist.

The weapon selection is decent, though I find it hard to find anything to be excited about. You can customize your weapons by choosing between features like an extended mag, a scope, or a silencer. Some weapons have multiple ammo types which don't really matter in a terrorist hunt. Character customization does not exist, but it isn't really needed.

Movement is slow, but that's to be expected. What isn't expected is the painfully slow sidestep. Having manual control over the motion of opening doors, crouching, and leaning is interesting and will probably be useful for hardcore players. The most welcome function is the ability to lean around corners. That's what tactical shooters are: Q and E to lean. Not recommended.

This game is the benchmark against which I measure all other tactical shooters and trust me when I tell you that practically no other game that has come out after Raven Shield measures up to it. SWAT 4 is very close but RVS comes out on top. In Rainbow Six 3 you take control of an international counter-terrorist unit called Rainbow and your job is to prevent terrorists from doing whatever it is that they are trying to do. To achieve this you use the powerful mission planner to plan your mission to the finest detail, coordinating up to three teams or a maximum of eight operatives. The planner will let you do anything you need to do to get the job done. For example you can set up go-codes to clear a room from multiple directions simultaneously. You can define how the teams make entry into a room: should they breach the door using a breaching charge? Should they throw in a flashbang or gas grenade before entering the room? You get the picture. You can also define the rules of engagement and movement speed of your teams for any waypoint. You can command them to be stealthy and only fire when fired upon for example or you can make them run and shoot on sight if you need to cover ground quickly to get to a hostage or bomb. The planner is awesome.

After you've finished planning your mission you can equip your teams any way you want. There's a lot of gear to choose from. There are light, medium and heavy armor and they affect your stealthiness and speed. Light armor is quiet and stealthy but does not offer much protection. Medium is a great balance and heavy armor looks kind of like riot gear and gives you extra protection but all your actions like switching weapons, turning around etc take a little longer to complete. You'll also be louder when you move. Then there are the weapons. There's a huge selection of SMG's, assault rifles, shotguns, sniper rifles, pistols, machine pistols, grenades etc. There is also a selection of tactical gear like heartbeat sensors, demolition kits (to speed up defusing of bombs), lockpicking kits etc. You can equip each individual operative however you want.

When you get in the mission itself you can switch between teams and operatives to control them at any time or you can stick to controlling your guy and let the AI do it's job according to the plan you've set out for those teams. The friendly AI is very good. The trailing guy will cover the rear of your team and they are very aware of their surroundings and they are accurate as well when firing. They're also good at clearing rooms. They get through the door quickly and each operative will cover their own area of responsibility in the room. You can command your AI team mates on the fly to perform actions like clearing rooms using breaching charges, flashbangs, gas grenades etc. You can also command them to pick locks, defuse bombs or to escort hostages out of harms way. You can perform these actions yourself also. The damage modelling is pretty awesome. You suffer different effects depending on where you're shot (if you're lucky enough to only get wounded that is). Your aim suffers a lot if you get hit in your arm for example. You can't run and your walking slows if you get hit in the leg and so on. Good mission planning is crucial because you want your team members to survive the mission so you can use them again. You have a limited number of operatives of varying skill levels and specialties and if they get wounded they will need time to heal before you can use them again. If they die you lose them for the rest of the campaign. The sounds are awesome too.

The enemy AI could be a little better although there's nothing in their behaviour that would get really annoying during gameplay. Sometimes one of them will drop a grenade as he dies and after it goes off you can hear "huh, what was that?" from the next room as if you can't tell when a frag grenade goes off in the hallway. They're pretty good at coming to investigate noises and stuff like that and they will use cover and get backup if you miss your shot and they get away. On the hardest setting they can be pretty brutal and it's tough to complete missions without any casualties to your team unless you've planned it perfectly.

After you get the hang of the game you can get online and you'll find there are still people playing. You can play adversarial modes or you can play the campaign missions co-operatively with your friends, coordinating take downs etc. using teamspeak for example. Multiplayer requires a ubi.com account and the game does lack voice comms of it's own but those are not big minuses.

The game is still every bit as awesome as it was when it came out. The graphics are a bit dated but it will run like a dream in very high resolutions and with ridiculous amounts of AA and AF on. With those kinds of settings it looks pretty good. Also you can get a mod called Raven Shield 2.0 that will enhance the realism of the game to even higher levels adding things like iron sights and it also has higher resolution textures for the operators and terrorists enhancing the look of the game. I wholeheartedly recommend this game to anyone who is a fan of tactical gaming and has somehow missed this gem. This is the best tactical shooter out there.

Tom Clancy's Rainbow Six 3 - were to start? I have infinite praise for this game.

This game is undeniably aged, but the gameplay mechanics still remain a pillar of tactical shooters to this day. Whether you go on a mission with a team of expert counter-terorist operatives, or you head into a mission lone-wolf, alertness and strategy is key to success - your life, your team's lives and the lives of helpless hostages all depend on your execution, which cannot be anything less than perfect.  

Before each mission you may chose from a range of multi-national Rainbow Operatives to accompany you on a mission. Each operative has his/her specialty - be it alertness, stealth, leadership or skills with various equipment from breaching charges to sniper support to clearing rooms in close-quarters combat. It is up to you to decide each member's loadout (primary, secondary, type of ammunition, accessories, armor type, etc.,) You may chose to go in with a single squad or split up into 3 separate squads. Then comes the fun part - mission planning: drawing up a master plan takes time and dedication to carrying out a successful mission with zero casualties. Doing so you can rely on your fellow squad members to carry out your plans perfectly automatically - while you are sweeping the basement another squad that you assembled will sweep the roof for you, according to plan. 5478461.review:
Where do I even start with this one? 
     It's the gold standard of the Rainbow Six series for starters. The game is arguably the funnest tactical shooter ever and this is the game people point to when asked about a more tactical and professional feeling Rainbow Six game than the action games like Rainbow Six: Vegas. Being a game from 2003, the graphics look a bit rough, though that doesn't hurt the gameplay at all. You play as a sort of commander for the elite, international, blacker-than-black ops team Rainbow. Rainbow specializes in counter-terror and hostage rescue missions and are deployed when needed around the globe. This means that the levels take place across a variety of settings. You'll go from saving dignitaries in the Swiss alps to foiling bank robbers in London to clearing a mansion of baddies in the Cayman Islands. This keeps things unique and interesting throughout the game.
      Each mission has a set pattern to it. You start by learning about the situation from Rainbow Six, the leader of Rainbow, and the other advisors with him. You then go to the team room where you select which operatives are going out on the mission, select their guns, armor, and other equipment, and choose what teams they'll be on. Then you go to the bread and butter of the game: the planning room. You are given a blueprint of the area and tasked with creating a plan for the teams to follow that will result in a successful mission. The planning system does take a bit of time to master but once the get the hang of things you'll find that the planning system is robust and customizable with a great depth to it. Once you have a plan created you can choose what team you'll be leading, in first person shooter style, through the action phase of the mission. 
     The action isn't as fast-paced as other games, but the methodical and tactical way that you can move through the area is unique, very enjoyable, and by no means boring. The action gameplay can shift from stealth to sychronized takedowns to all out gunfighting at a moments notice. The operatives and the terrorists all react realistically to bullets, meaning they die near-instantly. If that sounds too tough for the more tactical-minded gamers, you can also choose to observe the plan from a third-person flying camera and let the A.I take control of the operatives on the mission. You'll invariably find your plans don't always succeed, but there's much fun to be had from tweaking your plan until the teams move through the level like a well-oiled machine; to qoute the A-Team, "I love it when a plan comes together." On a related note there are pre-made plans that you can load in if you find the planning system too much to handle or are frustrated with repeated failures.
    The last great feature of the game is the custom mission option. This gives you access to all the maps that you've unlocked in the campaign and some that are only available in this mode and allows you to create a random mission from a good amount of mission types. Replaying story missions, terrorist hunt, hostage rescue, and lone wolf wherein you are alone and needing to get to the extraction point. The custom mission feature garuntees that you won't get bored with this game. Add to all the goodness explained already the fact that there's still a thriving modding community keeping this game fresh and adding better graphics and more gameplay to this already massive game and you've got a shining gem of the tactical shooter genre that still hasn't been topped in the decade that it has been out.

Всем привет.

Начну с того что игры из серии Rainbow имеют свою изюминку. В первую это не шутер типа контры где вы 24 часа в сутки бегаете с fn90- на даст 2. Здесь нет элементов крафтинга и прокачки персов. Если играете одиночную миссию с ботами, то все миссии можно пройти различными способами.

Первый способ. Чистая стратегия, медленно и педантично выбираете ботов по их "скиллу" ^^ хотя он и одинаковый у них , но есть незначительные отличия в аи. Тщательно выбираете контрольные точки, действия которые будут выполнять боты в этих контрольных точках, выверяете все действия на карте начиная от точки респауна  до точки куда надо вывести залогов ( на картах с залогами). Тип оружия и броню на любителя. Количество ботов на выбор. Режим игры средний или хард

Второй способ, который предпочитаю я. Никакой стратегии. Никаких контрольных точек , игра по наитию. Играть только на слух и с радаром , никакой беготни по карте, движения ботов  только мелкими перебежками и  длительным вслушиванием в обстановку в игре ( звук открывания двери,  голос залогов и теров). Оружее только со звукоподавителем и желательно оптика ( из штурмовых винтовок что-то типа AUG или снайперский Винторез) Бронька легкая или средняя. Количество ботов чем меньше тем лучше. Пару ботов оставить на точке охранения залогов и пара ботов на точке отхода команды спасения. Режим игры средний или хард.


Третий способ. Он похож на второй только с одним исключением. Берется самая убойная хня , оснащаете ею всех ботов , броня тяжелая и толпу ботов запускаете в раш, надеясь на удачу.

Четвертый способ. применяется исключительно если одна извилина на сером веществе или лень проходить  финальные миссии. Запускается игровая консоль, прописывается инвизибл, режим полета и бога, макс патроны)) Бронька  любая как и оружее. Главное помнить в режиме полета нельзя перезаряжаться и  переключаться на другого бота, И САМОЕ ГЛАВНОЕ ВСЕ ЭТО ДЕЛАТЬ НА САМОМ ЛЕГКОМ УРОВНЕ.

5025437.review:
특수부대 시뮬레이션. 90년대를 장식한 FPS 정통 레인보우의 마지막 시리즈. 3편인 레이븐 쉴드 이후로 게임성이 대폭 교체됐다. 여타 다른 게임들과 마찬가지로 진입장벽을 낮추기 위해 자신만의 특징을 버리고 강남 미인도로 재창조된 식. 따라서, 사실상의 마지막 레인보우.

게다가 레이븐 쉴드에 이르러 언리얼 엔진 사용등 전작들에 비해 대폭 향상된 그래픽과 시리즈 최초로 총기를 화면에 보여주며, 각 총기별로 완전 다른 손맛을 구현해 내어, 각 유저들마다 선호하는 총기가 극명하게 갈리는 혁명적 특징을 가지고 있다. 다른 FPS들의 밋밋한 손맛은 싱거워서 못할 지경. 내가 모던 워페어 시리즈에 맛 들리지 못하는 가장 대표적인 이유가 바로 이 게임이다. 콜옵 뿐만 아니라, 고금을 통틀어 FPS들이 죄다 무슨 총을 쏘던 손맛에 거의 차이가 없다. 난 사실 레인보우식스 3를 해 보고 앞으로의 게임들이 이런 손맛을 다들 구현해 낼 줄로 기대했었다. 그러나 이후 10년이 다 가도록, 그런 게임은 불행히도 나타나지 않았다. 무슨 말이냐 화를 내고 싶은 사람들이 여럿 있을 것이라 생각한다. 이런 사람들의 심정은 충분히 납득할 수 있다. 체험하지 않았다면, 나도 상상조차 못했을 것임을 잘 이해하고 있기 때문이다.

고전 게이머가 아니라면 단단한 각오를 해야 한다는 점을 미리 말해두고 싶다. 원샷 원킬은 레인보우 시리즈 만의 특징이었다. 한번 죽은 대원은 새로운 게임을 시작할때 까지는 영영 죽어버린다. 한대라도 빗겨 맞으면 돌이킬 수 없는 부상이 기다리고 있다.  나중 미션에서는 회복하긴 하지만, 즉시 회복할 수 있는 약상자 아이템이나, 총격을 받지 않고 잠시 숨어있으면 회복되는 얼토당토않은 시스템은 없다. 위와 같은 이유로 더 조심하고 더 긴장해야 한다. 치밀하게 짜여진 플랜에 맞춰 움직여야 하고, 개인행동은 팀원들의 생사에 직결되는 위험을 초래한다. 장비는 마음대로 바꿔들고 갈 수 있지만, 인질 구조와 같은 임무에서 소음기를 사용하지 않았다가는 인질이 그 즉시 사살당할 수가 있다. 저격이 일반 캐쥬얼 FPS 들과는 달리 무적이 아니다. 조준점이 모일 때 까지, 꽤 오랫동안 가만히 있어야만 하고, 앉은 상태에서는 이동을 할 수 없다. 영화에서 보듯, 높은 장소에 잠복해서 사냥감을 기다려야만 한다. 말하자면 엄청나게 현실적인 게임이다. 따라서, 난이도가 현실적이다.

수년 전 멀티가 활발하던 시절에는 팀 데스매치를 자주 했었다. 여타 FPS 게임들에서는 느낄 수 없는 극단적인 긴장감이 엄습한다. 빗맞아도 사망이기 때문에 총기는 잘 맞출 자신만 있으면 화력이 강하던 약하던 상관이 없다. 총소리가 마음에 드는 총을 써도 좋고, 색깔이 마음에 드는 총을 쏴도 좋다. 가끔 방탄복 위에 맞으면 멀쩡하거나 부상에 그치는 경우도 있긴 하지만, 대체로 한두발에 쓰러지기 때문에, 권총 또한 무서운 무기가 된다. 각종 전략적인 장비들을 이용해 상대방의 심장박동을 찾아 위치를 탐지하고, 거짓 박동을 하는 퍽을 던져 두어서 적을 혼동시킬 수도 있고, C4나 크레모아 같은 폭발물로 덫을 팔 수도 있다. 저격수는 연막을 뚫고 열 감지기로 적들을 제압할 수 있다.

지금은 이미 오랜 시간이 지나 멀티는 기대할 수 없다. 아직껏 몇몇 협동게임 서버만이 쓸쓸히 열려 있을 뿐이다.

그럼에도, FPS 역사의 한 획을 그은 그 대단한 레인보우의 명성이 궁금하다면, 반드시 해 봐야 할 게임임에는 틀림이 없다.

2187266.review:
Raven Shield is what many (myself included, if I'm honest) consider to be the best Rainbow Six game, as all the following entries in the series either fail at realism, (Lockdown) or straight-up take the 'arcade' route. (Vegas)

It's often compared to the likes of Counter-Strike, and I'd honestly say that it's better. This is because it adds a lot more to the table in terms of weapons, game modes, maps, decent AI opponents and team mates, as well as allowing you to perform more actions; as an example, you're able to 'fluidly' open doors so you can silently open it a crack to peep through, just swing it open, or even put a breaching charge on it.

In terms of weapons/gadgets you can use, other than having literally a mountain of guns to pick from, (although I always say the FNC and Steyr AUG are the best ;) ) ranging from assault rifles, sniper rifles, sub-machine guns, shotguns, light machine guns and pistols (including automatic pistols), there are a whole load of grenades and other equip-able items you can pick from. For example, there are of course your typical frag and flashbang grenades in the game, but there are also CS teargas (and gasmasks you can take to counter this) and smoke grenades. Not to mention the various other explosives and utilities, such as claymores + remote detonators (no magic hostile presence-detecting ones like in other games), C4 explosives, heartbeat detectors and many more.

Also, the iron-sight haters won't have a problem with R6 3:RS either, as they've still got the good ol' zoom - which shouldn't be an issue for those who dislike the zoom, as there are plenty of choices with scopes of varying types, as well as other attachments for your weapons.

So yeah, essentially if you want to play a realistic and fun shooter with loads of different tactics and choices, get this!

993807.review: Rainbow Six 3, like most of Tom Clancy's titles, is a squad-based tactical shooter with a lot of depth. This game favors tactics over action, and you will spend hours planning out each mission before actually playing it. Before a mission, you can choose who goes on what team (Alpha, Charlie, etc.), choose their loadouts (a lot of weapons to choose from, each with their own advantages and disadvantages), and plan out the mission waypoint by waypoint. Once you are comfortable with how the planning stage works, you can coordinate attacks from multiple angles, give go-codes to execute orders, set the rules of engagement, and so on. The game gives you the option to either play through the mission or watch the AI do what you have told them to do. It's a really nice option, because it's basically two totally different styles of gameplay. You can play it as a strategy game, being the man calling the shots, or play it through the eyes of a Rainbow operative. Pick this one up.

1941988.review: The Rainbow Six series has always been a favorite of mine. Not the Vegas series or Lockdown, mind you, but every game up to 3, and 3 is the best installment. It's one of the most realistic shooters you will ever play. You cannot rush into a confrontation without thinking or you WILL die in one or two shots. The best way to go through a mission with minimal casualties is to plan it out beforehand. When you're making a mission plan, you'll need to prepare for any situation, and even then, the enemy can surprise you, and one slip-up could ruin the entire operation. It involves a lot of trial and error, but once you finally make that one plan that has your team blaze through the mission with zero losses, you WILL feel proud of yourself for getting it right. In fact, once you get the hang of planning, you won't even need to control your squad directly anymore. The game allows you to watch the AI carry it out for you, and they're usually very competent. If you love tactical shooters, buy it.

1314212.review:
The last real Rainbow Six game. I'm not saying this due to opinion. The name 'Rainbow Six', in the Tom Clancy universe, refers to the leader of the multi-national counter-terrorism SOF 'Rainbow'. In every Rainbow Six up to this one (original, Rogue Spear, Covert Ops), you take that role; assigning team members to squads, choosing each member's loadout, creating a plan for each team to carry out during the course of each mission. Then you can either spectate or take control of one of the teams. You really can't even compare or argue the Rainbow Six games that came out after this because they are basically a different genre with different fans.

Post-Rainbow Six 3 (Lockdown, Vegas, Vegas 2, etc.) you only take control of a single protaganist throughout the entire game. You can't plan out the mission because the missions are linear and setpiece-focused, much like traditional FPS games. Your health regenerates in later games, and they have no wounding system. And while the Vegas games were still fun and you were still a member of Rainbow, you did not assume the position of the commander, Rainbow Six, in these games. And unfortunately, no big-name developer has made a game simliar to the old school Rainbow Six games in well over a decade.

4014725.review:
Pretty much the best tactical squad-based FPS that you can buy on Steam. Online multiplayer is still going somewhat strong. Given the game's age, that is a good indicator of how great it is!

If you only intend to play this with a friend co-op style, there is a revamp mod called RavenShield that updates the graphics quite a bit. However, installing this mod will make it so you cannot connect to "vanilla" servers.

Also, you'd hate this game; there's no hats to collect.

150506.review: The epitome of tactical first person shooter video games, and unfortunately the last of its kind. The gameplay of Rainbow Six 3 focuses heavily on the careful formulation and execution of player-made tactical plans in hypothetical scenarios, having players designate specific waypoints and commands to squads of soldiers in the game world (of which they also play the soldiers themselves after planning) in order to complete various objectives. While this may seem tiresome and mundane for players wanting instant and intense action (planning is optional), the reward for having a tactical plan execute successfully is extremely satisfying, considering the difficulty of the scenarios and the respective time taken to fully plan for them. Throw in a completely seamless multiplayer component and the thrills of planning tactical missions together with friends become unforgettably fun.

981778.review: Still the most tactical FPS game I've ever played. It doesn't have jump, but if you feel you need to jump in Raven Shield, most times you're doing it wrong. The Super-Elite AI mod and massive custom maps make even limited AI of 2003 a force to be reckoned with for anything less than 4-5 players with voice communication, and it's still a challenge then. The community has thinned out over time but with friends this will always be a classic.

277172.review: Mutliplayer is great with friends. Like all the earlier Rainbow Six games (and maybe even Vegas) the enemy AI always leaves something to be desired.
